column11: Review Text

One of our favorite place in Colombo .Colombo City Centre is an upscale shopping center featuring high-end shops, an international food court, and a multiplex cinema. it is conveniently located and represents the best of Sri Lanka with an innovative design inspired by Colombo's rich cultural heritage, and integrated with the style of a progressive Sri Lanka. Compared to other parts of Colombo, the mall is very clean and well-maintained .Right opposite Beira Lake, it's a convenient spot to explore other parts of Colombo. Offers high-end stores and popular international brands. A wide range of cuisine options, from local Sri Lankan to fast food chains. It's an upscale mall, so expect higher prices for food and shopping compared to other areas of Colombo. Overall, Colombo City Centre seems like a great option if you're looking for a modern shopping and dining experience in Colombo. Our favorite place is scope cinema . Scope Cinemas is a Sri Lankan cinema chain known for providing innovative cinematic experiences. There are three locations in Colombo. This is their flagship location and boasts the most features. It has 6 screens, including one with Dolby Atmos sound and 4K projection. They also offer a luxurious "Gold Class" experience.

Super spot for shopping in Colombo. Loved the Scooe cinema on the 3rd floor and PlayTrix sports bar is another place you must visit if you visit Colombo city center. Theyâ€™ve got their own residence as well. One of the best shopping malls in Colombo.
In my opinion it's an average mall with limited brands shop . The food court was not bad with McDonals . No Limit and Odel also were there . Don't compare it with other malls in East Asia.

It is a mall and as it is in the centre of the capital city it makes a fair starting point for a day out. It has everything you would expect, fashion, gifts, Starbucks and even a mini golf place. The outside balcony attached to the food court let it down as it is showing it's age.
Enjoyed an evening at Galle Face Green. Great family vibe. Road stalls and trucks catered for the locals and foreigners.
Limited stores on international brands. Food court is not good. Escalators are not organized well. It's an Ok mall to visit once if you have free time.

The security men in this shopping mall are very rude and behave in a threatening manner and it's very unsafe to visit this place as security are the people who are suppose to make the place safer for customers to visit.Security men act as if they own this place
This shopping mall is in the heart of Colombo. The mall is somewhat small compared to others but it has almost everything you are looking for. Scope cinema is located on the third floor.

Went to watch lost city last night, cinema 2 was ok seats were comfy screen size small but ok sounds were ok for that particular movie, however worst food court ever they have almost finished cheese pop corn this was around 1945 and I tried Mexican was cold and coke cups donâ€™t have lids guess they have finished them , they need to visit cinemas like VOX and learn few things I would try PVR next time even tho they are bit on the pricier side
Can have get the many wonderful and enjoyful  experiences at one place for teenagers,adults and foreigns also well....

We went to the mall hoping to buy some Sri Lankan gifts and clothing. Unfortunately, most of the stores are just American luxury brands. I'm American and the prices of the clothing in those particular stores was baffling (80USD for an UnderArmor tank top), more expensive than what I pay in one of the most expensive American cities. We found a few stores that at first didn't look like American brands but after going inside we found just cheap clothing with American slogans. The mall does have a rooftop and we were lucky to find a band playing live music outside but again, they were singing covers of American pop songs. I just don't understand why anyone coming to Sri Lanka would want to shop in such an Americanized place, we surely didn't. I get it's located near many tourist hotels but that's exactly what it felt like.. an overpriced tourist trap.

This shopping mall is well organized.  At the entrance, all the precautionary measures against Coronavirus were taken care of.  Hand Sanitizers, taking each oneâ€™s body temperature and checking of our bags before entering the mall, these steps were well organized.  Moreover the mall is big and there are lots of branded shops. The negative thing is that not all prices are good.  Some products are very cheap and some are very expensive.  There is also the illy coffee shop where you can just relax after moving around in all floors of the mall.  So if you are tourists..I highly recommend to visit this place.

A shopping mall with shops in leading brands. Situated in a nice surrounding facing Gangarama temple. Has spacious floors with good ventilation. People can hang around and shop or even do window shopping. Not much crowded in weekdays. Parking is large and the area directly connected to the shopping center. Parking is changeable. Food court or the dinning area has variety of selection among different styles including Sri Lankan. It has also got a cinema.

This is a manic city centre but well worth a visit. Plan a route ahead to visit all the popular sites on foot. It is easy. The alternative would be to take Tuk Tuk.  Be bold when crossing the road as the traffic will stop. Be timid and you will be there a long time!
Very clean and comfortable mall. I found dirty and many housefly in Sri Lanka everywhere, even in CMB airport, but not in this mall. Sure the item in here, which is much cheaper than CMB airport.
Good branded shops and the food court also has a good variety of cafes and restaurants. Very modern parking area too.
Location is best good thing i think about the mall. I couldnt see special thing in there. No need to huge kind but that mall is very ordinary even dough Ä±ts new

We went to see "Ginnen Upan Seethala", about the JVP insurrection, so took us back in time. The film was a rose tinted view of that episode in Sri Lankan history. The cinema was very modern and comfortable with decent service at a reasonable cost. Pity about the rather long commercial ads.
Pros- Great exclusive branded shops Cons - Not many choices You have to wait long time to park your car. Valet parking is extremely bad.
Colombo city finally has a shopping mall that actually lives up to the standards of a 'shopping mall', offering up a brilliant combination of retail, entertainment and culinary experiences

A worthy addition to the Colombo city with a panoramic view of the city's mushrooming skyline from the open deck of the food court. Good place to hangout, offers branded shopping experience and choice of food outlets. Does not match shopping malls like those in Dubai, yet good for Colombo. We had lunch at the North Indian outlet, supposedly run by Mango chain of restaurants, however the service and the food was 1 out of ten. Very small quantities and taste  but big on price. Will not eat from there again.

Today we were trying to book for a particular movie but unfortunately a wrong movie tickets were issued we tried calling the customer service number and the person flatly refused to re issue the tickets or issue a voucher WHICH IS A STANDARD WORLDWIDE PRACTICE as per scope policy if you have made an error or if you have an emergency or you need to reschedule then for them a customer has to loose the money spent and for them is a gauranteed sale made on asking the customer service attendant on what is the course of action he literally hung up on us twice. So we drive to the Ccc Scope and ask for a manager who was grabing a snack while on duty and wasnt of any help either and we wasted another 30 mins trying to rationalise with him that this is a consumer right and we had 8 hours of lead time prior to the booked show but they cared less. What is the point in bringing world class technology but you have primitive policies sad state of affairs reflects on the country and its citizens and the level of customer service. It's honestly a shame .

Good mall. But it's quite small compare to other international malls I have visited. This mall has grocery store,  kids indoor playground, movie theater, hair salon and message place and food court... Do, definitely it's a top mall in Colombo and can spend whole day there.
Colombo seems to be in a developing phase. This place is a new addition to the city. Everything that you expect in a modern place is here, and the view of the lake is absolutely fantastic.
Lovely place to walk around and watch a movie! Instead of eating at the food court I usually eat at the food hall at the cargils supermarket! Seafood pasta/spaghetti is a must try!! Amazing food!!

First of all, the drive way to the parking makes me really dizzy. We had to go several rounds in the driveway. Shopping, food and cinema are expensive compared to the other cinemas in the town. But definitely a class up than those. sound system is breath taking. Seats are very comfortable. A shot or two in those theatres for that price is not all that bad. But definitely a different look and feel than other higher class shopping malls in Colombo. But i think there is a lot of room improvement.

4 floors of branded shopping, however the selection is a bit limited. Pretty crowded with visitors and cinema goes, as well as food court lovers rather than shoppers. The shop staffing is pretty poor with no one really wanting to sell anything with interest. The place is clean and well maintained, food court is reasonably priced and the service was ok. Kids play area kept kiddo occupied, but had a queue and waiting time to get in. Assume the prices of brands are the same as the global market or a bit higher for some. Donâ€™t think Iâ€™d visit again unless the improve their selection.
This is a must-visit place in Colombo. They have many shops and places to eat at the location, reminds us of home. It is a kid's friendly mall and they have security as well. Its a good place.

Scope Cinema Theater is a lovely place & you can have a great movie experience for sure. The screen is superb & the sound system is awesome. Even though the ticket price is a bit high, you can justify it based on the cinema experience you can have. Anyhow thanks to HNB Solo, I got an offer & I paid only for one ticket & I received one ticket FOC. However, the food you purchase from the theatre food outlet was terrible & the prices are too much high & not fare. I ordered one Coca-cola cup 300ml (180/=) bit higher than other places like KFC, McDonald's etc. & One Tipitip. According to the consumer law in SL, we can forget the price of Coca-Cola cup since the Coca-cola company donâ€™t mention any maximum retail price for 300ml cup. But for Tipitip, the maximum retails price is clearly mentioned by the manufacturer & therefore no one canâ€™t sell above that price according to the law in SL. On the other hand, they donâ€™t allow you to bring at least a water bottle inside the movie theatre. So, if you want to have a good movie experience @ CCC Scope cinema, you have only two options. 1)	Just go there and enjoy the cinema without having any snacks or food. 2)	Or else pay a worthless high price for the snacks/foods & enjoy the cinema Finally, one more thing regarding the overall experience at CCC: Nothing special. The food is ordinary & overpriced. And It is just a shopping centre for the name.

CCC is a perfect place to shop and dine in Colombo. We had some bargains at some of the shops too. The dinner was not good as the first. Time we visited as the quality of the food has deteriorated over the time despite theres increase in price. The place is really beautiful and serene in the night with beautiful views. For the car park youâ€™ll have to pay now not like before but it has a smart paying system. This has very nice cinema hall which we are yet to experience.

I was booking for Alladin but confirmation came for some other movie in the same complex. It could have been a cyber error or an unintentional error on my part. I called many times to see whether I could have it changed as it was for the following day & I saw that practically three quarter of that hall was empty. After many attempts I was told they will not do so. Said I was not asking for refund just a change of hall in the same theatre complex. Surely, a big Cinema should have given me the benefit of the doubt and honored my request as I was losing Rs.4,000 on 4 tickets I booked on line. A manager with no heart.  Have been a frequent  visitor there but shall never ever go there again.

Colombo City Centre is a relatively modest shopping complex by global standards.  It does boast a multi-cinema complex and a great food mall with fabulous views of Colombo.  Most food genres are featured at reasonable prices.  The shopping is ok albeit at the upper end of the price spectrum. (Odel, designer labels, etc). It is nicely laid out and it appears they will have regular attractions on the ground floor.  For tourists I don't see this as a 'must see'.  If travellers are looking for unique Sri Lankan goods, then Barefoot and Kreation are best for handlooms and some souvenirs.  For dinnerware (dishes etc) then Noritake and Dankotawa have several showrooms in the city.  Batik and hand painted silk - try Yoland (Crescat Boulevard), Buddhi Batiks(Ward Place) or ShreeDevi Batik (Marino Mall).  Costume and semi precious Jewellery - Stone n String (Galle Road).  There are a number of souvenir shops dotted around most major cities and places frequented by tourists.  Colombo City Centre does have a great Cargills Supermarket, with great fresh produce and well stocked shelves.  It also features a good food court (no view!).
This is modern mall located in city center with best of the modern amenities. Host all international brands and a cool foodcourt
A new age mall located in city center offering best of the brands and cool food court. A typical shopping exp for any shopoholic.

If you are coming to do shopping then the prices will be a little too high than other places. However the location is good and accessible to the main roads and some famous landmarks so the tourists could easily find the area.

the mall is new lots of shops, nice movietheater, nice foodcourt with different food options and different kitchens lot like mc where it's just a name and all are fried rice . here you can choose indian, sri lanka, indonesian, portugees, mc donalds; coffeeshop , cakeshop, icecream,;;;;japanese

I visited this Mall in April 2019. Mall is located near buddha temple. It has 5 floors with so many shops for shopping. It has food court which offers distinguished varieties of food from different regions. It has food hall named 'Cargills' in basement.

We stopped off here to kill some time and get out of the terrible traffic that is Colombo. There is something for everyone here food, groceries, retail stores abound and after being throughout the country for 3 weeks I must have looked like a deer caught in headlights as it was bright, clean and western culture such a change from other towns. Well worth a stop to break you back into our normality before heading home.

Colombo city center is newly open shopping mall in heart of Colombo. There is luxury brand collection. Shopping complex include cloths, watches, electric items, food court, kids play area, movie theater, food city, etc. Well clean and well maintained.
All new things are available in one place. best place to buy for quality goods. Food Court also available in the down stairs.

Clearly this Mall has opened recently as it is pristine in appearance. What made it great for us was the lack of people, obviously that it is not good for the shops!! Not a fan of shopping so this makes it a lot easier, loads of branded names here so will suit all tastes. Huge Cahills supermarket in the basement with its own food hall. Great choice including Sushi for cheap prices.

I stayed at Haven Fort Hostel at Vauxhall Street, walked my way to Seema Malakaya. I saw this Colombo City Centre opposite Seema Malakaya and decided to visit the shopping mall. The weather in Colombo in Mar was terribly hot and it was like discovering an oasis in a desert. The moment you walk into the building, the cool and refreshing air conditioner air immediately `quenched' and reduced the bodily heat temperature to a comfortable level. I found it cool and refreshing roaming in the comfortable environment and visiting the shops from the ground floor to the food studio and the cinema area. It was like any of the shopping malls in Singapore but such cozy medium scale shopping malls seem few in Colombo. The panoramic view outside the veranda of the food studio was spectacular. You could view Seema Malakaya and the adjacent Gangaramaya Park from a helicopter view. Colombo looks more like a metropolis with the lake in the center surrounded by skyscrapers. It was surprising to see a Singaporean Snacks food stall occupied the front visible row of the food court. A group of Chinese tourists sat at the middle seats in the food court munching their fast food burgers. A juice salad stall and a Dessert Bar occupied the central area and prominently displayed mouth watering juices to customers. I like the Cargills Food Hall (supermarket) at the basement. There was a promotional 50% discount for a Kist funfruit juices and I bought a packet of the mixed fruit juices and sat at a cozy relaxed corner just outside the supermarket enjoying and quenching my thirst. On one occasion, I bought a tub of Vanilla ice-cream and enjoyed my ice cream at the same corner. Outside the supermarket, there is a stall displaying a unique range of souvenirs and ornaments. The Spa Ayurveda shop looks unique with her attractive colorful design and I like the scent and aroma of the products in the shop. This is a great place to cool yourself and get refresh for the next adventure around Colombo. The short respite rejuvenated my spirit. I visited here for 3 occasions and would highly recommend you to be here for the panoramic view and cheap sales at the Cargills supermarket.
Its a nice new mall. Opposite lake. Big mall but mostly empty. Not much crowd. Good food court. Price reasonable.  Worth a visit
the centre has many of the brands that one sees abroad but at a price. parking is at higher levels of the centre. there is also a vast food court with different types of eateries

Nothing much to buy / just softlogic and abans stores The food court is totally overpriced and not very clean I feel - specially after the news of worms in the food The place is empty with not many people (other than to the cinema) and they charged for parking even if you go to the supermarket !

The heavy vehicles are using new over powered horns. At 91 decibels, your ears can tolerate up to two hours of exposure. At 100 decibels, damage can occur with 15 minutes of exposure. At 112 decibels, damage can occur with only one minute of exposure. At 140 decibels, immediate nerve damage can occur. so make sure you wear ear plugs

loved the colombo city centre mall well versed with all international brand variety of international food in food court spread into 4 floors the day we went it fully decorated due to coming independence day they even have cinema loved this air conditioned mall

Newest addition to the Colombo; CCC is located facing Bere Lake few minutes away from famous Gangarama temple. Upmarket shopping mall has a fair collection of local and foreign fashion and cosmetics brands. Prices are bit high compare to other shopping malls in the area but,  less cluttered stalls may have something matching your taste. Ground floor has a supermarket for groceries and upper floor has a modern movie theater. Food Studio, the food court is the main attraction. Overall worth paying a visit.

I found the store with more variety than normal stores. One can even buy cold fresh milk! I enjoyed a steak meal from the restaurant as well as a cappuccino and fruit box from adjacent stalls. I found this food area cheaper and less crowded than the food area higher up. I recommend going there for a meal.
Lovely atmosphere - very cosmopolitan. The ambience is superb. The food court has variety and is designed very well.
Best shopping mall in Colombo, with great views and CLEAN facilities. The place is ideal for a hot day and for some shopping while enjoying a movie.

It is a complex of mixed development in an attractive high rise with a shopping centre, apartments and others. Shopping complex which is the area for the public have some brand outlets to attract the high end market. From the entrance the interiors look more linear and deep with at least three or more floors occupied by sellers offering some known Australasian and International brands. If one is serious in shopping it will be a place to spend a few hours. There is an interesting food court with several speciality outlets. Terrace of the food court is a nice area to chill out with a cool breeze in the evening enjoying a meal or a punch. View from the terrace captures the skyline towards the west from Colpetty to Galle face area. Terrace overlooks the Beira lake with a splendid view of the water body and "Seemamalakaya" of the temple which is lit beautifully in the evening.

Itâ€™s a modern shopping mall with lots of shops & few high end designer shops as well... it has a multiplex & food court with fews of the city overlooking the man made lake. The complex is part of a residential building hence good walk-in clients as well.

Yes it was a great shopping mole in Sri Lanka every thing in one room & we really enjoyed lot with meals - North Indian # Pani Puri & Vegetable Biriyani . Also we have time to do shopping as much as relaxed. Really nice time , it was -December shopping Menia. It gets shirt time to reach because its in Colombo . Cinema & Food court is my best place to feel & enjoy.

It's a modern mall, just like so many others in the city. The supermarket in the basement had employees doing chants and cheers just outside the entrance, two open checkout lines with employees moving veeeeery slowly.

CCC is the latest cool spot in Colombo. The stores themselves and shopping is on par with Regional rivals and the food court and cinemas a great. I had the chance to sample Oporto Double Bondi burger!! Wow loved it and so tasty. Great value as well. Give it ago rather than Mcdonalds ðŸ¤®

Colombo City Centre is the latest shopping centre in colombo. I am sure in a short time it will be the place to head to  with family snd friends to spend some wuality time ..It has all that you need from a odel outlet to top branded stores for clothing ,shoes,jewellery ,Apple store..to a food court to satiate all taste and age ...another plus is a movie theatre the best in town with s supermarket at the basement ...great place  for entertainment dining and shopping ...
Awesome shopping centre with many features and unique shops. Best features are the cinema and food court!

Now almost all the stores are open one can shop for all the designer labels in one place. Thereâ€™s very good entertainment: 1. Scope cinema showing all the latest movies. Be sure to book online if youâ€™re going in weekend 2. Food court- donâ€™t forget to try sushi (downstairs) and Chinese dishes (upstairs) 3. Entertainment for children- game zone Pricy. Make sure to take socks, otherwise you have to buy from them. 4. Cargills- one of the best Cargills branches. You can get all high end and imported cooking ingredients. Their juice stall has cheap yet tasty variety of fresh fruit juices Highly recommended place to visit in Colombo

I recently visited the City Centre shopping centre. it is a nice clean shopping mall with Cargills in the basement. It has a good range of shops including many well known brands. Well worth a visit on a hot humid day.

This is new mall developed in Colombo. Very good location and spacious.shops are also good like Armani. Verity of tea of cyclone is also on sale.very huge food court and cinema hall.it a good place to spent quality time with family. Viddyapati chaudhary Lucknow india

Parking is at the top so we had quite a thrilling ride up a spiral drive way to reach the 4th floor! Wonderful views of the city on the way. From the Food Court also you get an amazing view of the Beira Lake. This is definitely a high-end mall with all designer shops! Good for window shopping for middle income folks like me! Beautiful Christmas decor. Kids loved the extremely tall Christmas Tree extending up to the top floors... We enjoyed Japanese rice and Pasta Carbonara. About Rs1200 per person...so on the high side. They give you a little gadget which buzzes when your food is ready. So you can order and then go and do your own thing until the food is prepared.

Watched three movies at three different theatres/halls at CCC.The halls were very clean, seats were comfortable and staff were friendly. However, two times we experienced that the doors were opened 15 minutes late than the schedule time as the previous movie was still running. Also at the start of the movie adverts were played for 15 minutes. In total 30 minutes were wasted. Considering the premium price charged it's not acceptable.

This is a new shopping mall here. The prices on the higher side. The food court has a good selection of out lets.We selected the items and paid for at mala hotpot.What we got was all fried no hot pot.This is srilanka style hotpot.The food and service horrible at Mala hotpot.The food expensive.   Isle of gelato service was also horrible. We were in front of the cashier he was watching his smart phone.There was a girl and a boy standing behind him the girl was on the phone the boy was watching the cashiers phone.We had wait then the girl served us .The icecrem was very expensive. The girl at the Srilankan counter was very good. The view of the lake beautiful from the food court.

For a new shopping mall in the heart of Colombo this place is seriously expensive. It should definitely be called a high-end maul. While the building itself is very impressive, the entire place is filled with designer shops and unless you have very deep pockets, I would give this place a miss. I am from the UK, and am fortunate enough to be able to have the financial means to spend should I wish, but please be warned, there are few bargains to be had here, and who doesn't like a bargain? There are a lot of places to shop in Colombo, where you can buy the same items for a lot cheaper. However, if only designer goods will do, then this is the place for you.

A new mall and great place to get away from the heat. There are cinemas on the top floor and a newly open supermartket (Cargills) at the bottom floor. The supermarket has a small food section which sells reasonably priced food like pastas, burgers, sushi etc. Fresh fruits section was also quite extensive. The mall has a food court upstairs. A good place to have a meal at an air-conditioned place and to charge your handphones ( there are sockets points at some of the beams). Outdoor section is also nice especially at night whether the weather is cooler. Shopping wise, there are still some vacant lots which have not been occupied and

I know most tourists would rather not visit yet another soulless shopping mall, preferring to sample local shopping areas and eateries, BUT if the bottom has fallen out of your world, because the world has fallen out of your bottom, due to too much rice and curry â€“ then head to Colombo City Centre Mall. The Food Court has a good variety of cuisine: From Pizzaâ€™s, Sandwiches and Salads to Japanese, Indonesian, and Portuguese.  The dumplings on the Mezzanine level are fab!  Its perfect for families or groups where everyone wants something different, or for kids who struggle with curries. If you just fancy a cuppa, Tea Farerâ€™s lovely Tea sommelier Arsha will look after you and make you feel very welcome, telling you all about Sri Lankaâ€™s romantic history with tea.  Serving everything from jasmine infused green teas and rooibos, to cold tea concoctions and just a good old builders brew, a pot for two is around 400Rs (approx. Â£2). Also on Mezzanine.

We went to watch Bohemian Rhapsody on Friday night and it was surely a great movie but also the scope cinemas are doing a good job too. CCC is another step in the right direction for Colomboâ€™s list of things to do. While waiting for the movie we also had meals at the food court and it was great, the place is clean and well maintained. The only area of improvement for scope cinemas are to improve their list of snacks for the movie, pop corn and milo wont do. Nachos, hot dogs, crepes these are next level snacks if you want to have a next level cinema. The other issue was the movie timing: we went for a 9:30PM movie but at 9:30 the previous movie was still playing, that movie finished around 09:35 and people were coming out and it wasnt very organised as the entrance and exit to the cinema is the same, hence it was all crowded at the foyer. We were only let in by around 09:50 after cleaning and the movie started around 10:10 after all the ads.

We visited the Colombo City Centre yesterday afternoon for lunch and all of us loved the great environment and atmosphere there. We were a group of around 20 colleagues and we dined at various food outlets in the food court, I dined at the Japanese outlet and I really enjoyed my meal it was really worth the money. I recommend this place as a great place to hangout and have a chat.

Really well laid out shopping mall. Has most things youâ€™d need and a pretty decent food court and cinema. As itâ€™s so new there are still a few shops under construction. Will definitely be worth going to once they are. Lots of western brands there.

New shopping centre.  Nothing special.  BUT, Go to the food court which is on the upper floor, it has an open space outside which has a bar.  it overlooks the lake.  Great place to have a beer and look out to the lake.

Colombo city centre is new addition to Colombo shopping malls. It has several baranded shops and local shops too.. it's well maintained specious and clean. Cineplex cinema is incredible but show timings are bit confusing. Best popcorns which I ever had tho. Food court is plus point for hang around with friends. Different stalls for variety of foods. Out door deck has  Stunning view of the Colombo city and can enjoy to the view while having food.

Scope cinema was a great experience but the toilets and timings of movie was not to standard. Movie started late.No litterbins in theater. Cleaning delays and movie timing did not take into account longer movies. Left patrons hanging around needlessly.

Visited at lunchtime but they had already run out of rice and offered mashed potatoes instead. The food was tasty so this wasn't a big deal. Staff are friendly but other than the owner/manager, the others are still unsure of what to say or do.
Food court with Asian Italian Arabian and so many food stalls to pick from outdoor and indoors dinning, flim halls shopping areas 5 flours and many more to keep one enterentertained the whole day.

This is the latest mall in Columbo - though small by international standards - good to pass time and you could just do some shopping or watch a movie. There is a very nice food court with many cuisines.

Colombo city center is the hottest place in Colombo at the moment. Filled with all the branded shops and genuine products, this place has a class written all over it. 06 movie theaters with absolutely marvelous food court which has many variety of cuisines from all over world for a reasonable prices too. When it comes to shopping this place has all the popular brands in the world under one roof, so if you are a serious shopper who would not accept anything other than originals CCC is the place for you. But you need to be lucky to get a slot in the car park though ðŸ˜• the only draw back I see, itâ€™s always full and I had to turn back couple of days as it was full. May be it is temporary I guess till the heat is dried out. But once you get in to the car park letâ€™s just say itâ€™s a whole round experience ðŸ¤ª. So have fun guys and enjoy the CCC like we did. Itâ€™s a hip place to be, hang out and chill enjoying the beautiful view of the city over the Bere lake.

I visited this place on the opening day and there after two times. Found some genuine branded products there. Abans Home and Odel shops were excellent. The entire complex is beautiful. But the prices for food in Food court is bit expensive. Not worth the prices they charge.

Plenty of international brands and with some local brands at under one roof. Cinema and food courts attract more costumers. after open the star class hotels and residences and officers this will be the most happening location in the city.

There's a plethora of shops but the reason I keep coming back to the CCC is the excellent gelato they have in the food court. It's genuine artisan gelato, rich and creamy, with a wide variety of flavors that I can't get enough of. A quick review of the highlights: Chocolate Sorbert - rich, dark and so intensely flavored that it has to be savored in small tastes. It's the equivalent of aged brandy or very strong rum. Fior de Latte  - if you've never had it before, you must try it now! It's basically sweetened milk, a very pure, clean taste with just enough sweetness. There's no other way to describe it except milk with sugar turned into gelato somehow. Chunk in Yo Trunk- vanilla with brownie chunks and swirls of caramel, it's a gooey delicious treat. The brownies are homemade and absolutely fabulous! Bacio - the original Nutella ice-cream, Bacio is a combination of hazelnut and chocolate. It's a mild, smooth gelato, one with a more subtle flavor to it. Straciatella - delicious slivers of dark chocolate in a strong, creamy gelato. The chocolate is the good quality kind, you can taste the bitterness and the high cacao content in it, and the gelato is the perfect encasing for it.

The complex was very impressive and shops carry quality products. However there are many more unitilised shop spaces. We saw â€œFirst Personâ€ at the multiplex cinema and it was a lovely experience on par with international standards. Delicious caramel popcorn! Unfortunately the food court experience wasnâ€™t that great- perhaps because we went late around 8.45 pm. Especially the Indonesian and the Tepanyaki, with whatever food on display looking stale and unappetizing. Ended up eating the worst Oporto chicken wrap that had a few measly pieces of chicken and was tasteless. I felt I was biting into plain bread! The Mango Tree food was fresh and tasty although limited in range. Isle of Gelato kept up to its name and this time I tried the Avocado Sorbet which was just SO good and tasting of fresh avocado! Overall ambience in the food court was nice though and we will go again but perhaps try at lunch time.

Things are moving and changing in Colombo finally. This is a very modern shopping mall for the Island and is doing pretty well. Still a lot of Singalese people will just watch and enjoy, but it has definately a good future. Food court is well visited and used. Quality of shops and food is good. Good parking facilities.
This is a brand new and modern shopping mall with up-market shops and a fantastic food court.  Will be great when all the shops are occupied

State of art new shopping mall with a vast food court area as well. Hassle free parking and have most of the leading branded shops. Food court is also having large variety of food comprising Western,Eastern, Indian etc. Food court area has a balcony overlooking Colombo city with a nice view. Must visit place.

I recently visited the new Colombo City Center (Mall) a few times.  It is a great place to shop, but even better to eat.  The new food court offers an amazing selection of different cuisines and seems to be the place to be seen and to meet new people. Apart from the great food, there is also the best cinema in Sri Lanka where you can catch up on the latest moves. Although not a touristy place, it is a great place for weary travelers to have a great meal and do some great shopping.

This new mall is fabulous and luxury oriented. Most of the branded brands in Sri Lanka are there. Their food court is very spacious and reasonably priced. They also have the latest cinema. 3 floors of indulgence.

apart from branded shops the food court and the cinema is the best. The cinemas standards are almost same as Dubai. Excellent views from all the seats, picture quality is excellent. price is bit higher than other places but it's worth the price.

Colombo City Center gives a wonderful shopping experience and you can spend at least half a day by shopping in different shops inside this shopping mall. Of course the prices are quite expensive because the target audience of this mall is high income people. The food court of this mall is really amazing. You can have the food from different countries like Japan,China,Singapore, Indonesia and India etc.. The architecture of this mall is very similar to an international shopping mall in Dubai. Therefore, by visiting this mall Sri Lankans can gain an international shopping experience ðŸ•ðŸ¥ªðŸ²ðŸŒ®ðŸœðŸ¦

Dangerous to open up a mall while the tower of apartments is still under construction. Besides that, still a lot of shops to be opened, which gives the entire mall an unfinished look. On the positive side: the Odel Department Store deserves a mentioning for being so large and organised. Hopefully they will keep it that way. Also the Miniso shop is lovely. And last but not least: the Food Studio offers a stunning view over the Beira Lake! Plenty of choice for foodies! Once the entire area is finished, it will certainly look astonishing, but... there are more malls coming right next door (Altair).

This is place is really good to enjoy some time with families & friends. Newly opened & bit crowdy. It has plenty of parking & it's free. They have electric charging points for electric vehicles. It includes shopping centers, cinema's, the food court.

Hi My first visit to Sri Lanka and Colombo and being a Shopping Centre sort of chap, visited CCC WOW - what a place - a breath of fresh air when you consider this is a small centre (about 20 000m2) - spotlessly clean - great facilities, parking, access and security - beautiful stores, especially the local Tea Shops - wondrous parking For me their food court is AMAZING - a great range of cuisines available, clean and tidy and very busy, with an outside lake view seating area Oh, and their six screen multiplex cinema has just opened! A jewel in the real estate crown of Colombo indeed! Well done team CCC J

We visited the CCC and was pleasantly surprised by the quality and variety of food stalls available at its food court yesterday. They have different cuisines such as Japanese, Chinese, Singaporean , Indian and of course SriLankan with the fast food options such as burgers and sandwiches and wraps. We found the especially the Japanese and Chinese options to be very tasty and the fresh fruit mock-tails to be delicious and being value for money.

Colombo City Centre is the most international upscale shopping mall in Colombo. It has just opened with a range of international and leading local brands/department stores. Includes, Apple,Colombo Jewellery Stores and Odel Department Store. There is a cinema and food court. The shops may not be exciting for the average tourist as largely expensive but the cinema and food court could appeal.
